extendedInfo.description: The CodeRED Mobile Alert app keeps users informed and ahead of the storm. Designed to keep you informed and aware, the CodeRED Mobile Alert app taps into the national CodeREDÂ® Emergency Notification System and alerts subscribers located within the reach of a given notification generated by public safety officials. The app is geo-aware so no matter where you are when an alert is issued, you will receive notifications that affect you - right on your mobile device. The app transmits geographically-based notifications; requiring subscribers to enable their location services so the app can determine the userâs specific location. The CodeRED Mobile Alert app delivers information from community officials in areas that are subscribed to the CodeRED Emergency Notification System. Additionally, national organizations used by public safety officials and police departments may utilize the system to send messages to targeted geographic areas. Future uses could include augmenting Federal Government issued critical alerts, such as those transmitted through IPAWS as an additional Alert Disseminator in support of the FEMA program. The app comes with a complimentary 30-day trial of CodeRED Weather Warningâ¢, a program that sends subscribers notifications when they are in the projected path of severe weather. Notifications are received from The National Weather Service and immediately communicated with CodeRED Mobile Alert subscribers without any delay. The CodeRED Weather Warning add-on is an additional $4.99 per year. If your city or state does not currently subscribe to the CodeRED Emergency Notification System, contact your elected officials today to let them know that your community would benefit from this service.PLEASE NOTE: Subscribers are encouraged to turn OFF GPS location services and turn ON wireless network location services to reduce battery drain.Questions or issues regarding the app? Before writing a negative review, contact us â weâre here to help! Email us at mobilecontactus@ecnetwork.com or call toll-free to 866-533-6935.

reviews.title: Flawless!
reviews.comment: The mobile alert is so easy to use and it works great! I have not experienced any problems or any battery draining issues... Just solid, up to date, useful information that is extremely helpful weather I am home or traveling. Great job!
reviews.author: Bob Wood

reviews.title: Will Not Open (App is now fixed)
reviews.comment: I have an older model ATRIX. The app will not open & forces close whenever I try. It would be a great app, I think, if it would work on my phone. Please fix!!!! 08-08-13 The bugs have been fixed & I am now getting alerts!! Thank you!!!
reviews.author: Deb Dickerson

reviews.title: Since when did ad spam become part of a paid app?
reviews.comment: Don\'t like being spammed with advertising on apps that I pay for.  I will be looking for an advertisement free app to replace this app as soon as my paid subscription expires.
reviews.author: Veronica McComack

reviews.title: Not free!
reviews.comment: Not free, uninstalled.
reviews.author: Rebecca Lynn

reviews.title: Great Improvements
reviews.comment: This is much better. Batt life is not a problem and UI is great. Great job.
reviews.author: NICHOLAS ANDERSEN

reviews.title: Galaxy S3 cannot login
reviews.comment: I installed this app on my and my wife\'s phones. Unfortunately I have been unable to log into either my or her accounts on either device. I have sent the support group an email and have yet to receive a response.  I am getting the \"user name or password is incorrect\" message.  I have verified it against my web login and \"hunt-n-pecked\" the password and it still didn\'t work.
reviews.author: Brian Miller

reviews.title: Has been better
reviews.comment: This app used to work perfectly before the drastic UI overhaul. Now...not so much. My paid subscription is due to expire in 4 days and even if I wanted to renew, I can\'t. The link to take me to that page isn\'t working.
reviews.author: Pamela McCarter

reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.comment: Doesn\'t open. Just freezes phone or force closes itself. Uninstalled
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: no real use
reviews.comment: Does not coordinate with government.  Is not stable.  Do not use for anything except play.
reviews.author: Steve Hurd

reviews.title: Warning area is to small
reviews.comment: Have not had a chance to get weather warnings yet but from the problems I had getting the app to run to begin with and now the app only allows for a 10 mile radius for warnings (that is a joke). Weather is on top of you with only a 10 mile setting. It needs to be at least a 25 mile radius or greater. You want to know its coming in advance...not know it is already sitting on top of you.
reviews.author: Mark Huber

reviews.comment: This app is garbage because it won\'t let me in my own account. If you want a star... Keep wishing for one.
reviews.author: Richard Koenig

reviews.title: Register
reviews.comment: I really don\'t like being forced to register to use the app No thank you.
reviews.author: Hans De Kryger

reviews.title: Will Not Open
reviews.comment: I have attempted this app multiple times and it has failed every time.
reviews.author: Susie Rushing

reviews.comment: Crap. Won\'t even open don\'t waste your time
reviews.author: Erika Buonpastore

reviews.title: Horrible.
reviews.comment: I loved it when I didn\'t have to log in. Now it keeps crashing when I try to register! I need something I can depend on!!!!  PLEASE FIX REALLY FAST OR ELSE I WILL UNINSTALL.
reviews.author: Joanie Dale

reviews.title: Don\'t bother
reviews.comment: App doesn\'t open.
reviews.author: Arlena Hernandez

reviews.title: Not good
reviews.comment: I can\'t login with the s3 not a good program.
reviews.author: Garret Stensland

reviews.title: Wow, I love it!
reviews.comment: Wonderful user-friendly interface, works fast,  amazing on my new android. Highly recommended.
reviews.author: alex alex

reviews.title: Better now
reviews.comment: The application\'s latest release fixes a lot of bugs. It is actually usable now!
reviews.author: Patrick Mallahan

reviews.comment: Poor interface!  Unable to scroll down past username and password to log in.  A total waste of 4.99 & discredits the city of Lakewood for providing such a poor emergency notification system.\tPoor interface!  Unable to scroll down past user name and password to log in.  A total waste of 4.99 & discredits the city of Lakewood for providing such a poor emergency notification system.
reviews.author: Tyler Mary Casias
